pageContext.claim: “Nearly 50 migrants a day are being referred for medical assistance -- they are very, very sick -- making this a health crisis as well.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump exaggerates a perfectly normal statistic into a full-blown "health crisis." U.S. officials are referring 50 migrants to medical providers per day on average. But the reasons are varied and may not be as serious in some cases as Trump implies. Moreover, nearly 2,000 migrants a day are encountered at the southern border on average. Referring 50 cases (2.5 percent) to medical providers for any conceivable medical reason is not a crisis rate.
